definition:
The [*National Science Foundation*]{} (NSF for short) is an agency of
the United States government which primarily promotes research in
engineering and computer science (playing a pivotal rôle in the
development of the Internet, for example), but also gives grants to
professional mathematicians for research in pure and applied
mathematics. The involvement of the NSF in mathematics educations has
had its share of controversy, however.
